overview_of_class: This course provides an overview of quantum mechanics from a materials science perspective. Exact solutions to the Schrödinger Equation will be derived including one-dimensional potential energy wells and barriers, three-dimensional spherically symmetric potentials, and periodic potentials. In addition, approximation methods will be implemented such as the variational principle and perturbation theory.
name: Advanced Physics of Materials
title: MEAS MAT_SCI 451-0-01 Advanced Physics of Materials

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: MSE 351-1 or equivalent background in introductory undergraduate-level quantum mechanics; please seek consent of instructor if unsure.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Four 50 minute lectures per week with discussion, homework, midterm, and final exam.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Course grades will be determined from homework (25%), a mid-term exam (35%), and a final exam (40%).

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: D. J. Griffiths, Introduction to Quantum Mechanics, 2nd Edition, Pearson Prentice Hall (2005), ISBN: 9780131118928
